How to Install ii-esu on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • ii-esu

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install ii-esu on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing ii-esu on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall ii-esu in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install ii-esu, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install ii-esu Using apt

To install ii-esu in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install ii-esu using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install ii-esu

The installation of ii-esu might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install ii-esu Using apt-get

To install ii-esu using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install ii-esu.

sudo apt-get -y install ii-esu

Install ii-esu Using Synaptic

To install ii-esu using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install ii-esu on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for ii-esu. This will display the ii-esu package in the package window, now to install ii-esu, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the ii-esu package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of ii-esu.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install ii-esu Using aptitude

To install ii-esu on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of ii-esu.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install ii-esu using the command aptitude install ii-esu.

sudo aptitude -y install ii-esu

How to Upgrade ii-esu on debian

If you want to upgrade the ii-esu package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade ii-esu using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade ii-esu to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade ii-esu.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade ii-esu sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade ii-esu

Upgrade ii-esu using Aptitude

To upgrade ii-esu using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade ii-esu.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade ii-esu

Upgrade ii-esu using Synaptic

To upgrade ii-esu using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for ii-esu, now right-click ii-esu, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade ii-esu just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall ii-esu on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall ii-esu from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just ii-esu, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove ii-esu

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of ii-esu

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of ii-esu you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge ii-esu

Remove ii-esu using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall ii-esu using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for ii-esu, right-click the ii-esu package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall ii-esu click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install ii-esu on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade ii-esu using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of ii-esu then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
